page.title: 11LIFE STYLE - TRAVEL & HEALTH
page.content: In a rural area, travel is of vital importance (see ownership of cars, motorcycles, etc.). For example, we surveyed the distances of family doctors' surgeries: 9% of families were on lists of doctors 3 miles distant, 9% 4 miles distant, 9% 7 miles, and 9% each 10 and 12 miles distant. 55% of families have to travel over 6 miles to see their family doctors, and as it is at present the encouraged practice for patients to visit the doctor at the surgery, rather than the doctor the patient at his home (except in an emergency), the importance of independent travel is doubly underlined.
